intro: Dasystephana frigida, commonly known as the cold-loving orchid, is a rare and delicate plant native to the high altitudes of southern Africa. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to withstand frost and low temperatures. The plant features a slender, branching stem with small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale blue, with a distinctive, intricate pattern on the petals. Due to its specific habitat requirements, Dasystephana frigida is considered a vulnerable species and is often found in specialized botanical gardens.
